metadata.name: Disable Windows Defender AV Security Monitoring
metadata.comment: Detects attackers attempting to disable Windows Defender using Powershell

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND ((endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('powershell\.exe', 'pwsh\.dll')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-disablebehaviormonitoring $true')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-disableruntimemonitoring $true'))) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\sc.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('sc.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('stop')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('windefend')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('delete')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('windefend')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('config')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('windefend')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('start=disabled')))))

output.summary: Detects attackers attempting to disable Windows Defender using Powershell

metadata.objective: False positive: Minimal, for some older versions of dev tools, such as pycharm, developers were known to sometimes disable Windows Defender to improve performance, but this generally is not considered a good security practice. References: https://research.nccgroup.com/2020/06/23/wastedlocker-a-new-ransomware-variant-developed-by-the-evil-corp-group/, https://rvsec0n.wordpress.com/2020/01/24/malwares-that-bypass-windows-defender/, https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1562.001/T1562.001.md
